original_title: Sri Lanka president declares health, electricity and petroleum services essential
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has made electricity, distribution of petroleum and health as essential services, a government statement said.

In an extraordinary gazette notification issued on Thursday (17), the president said the declaration was being made considering the services provided by any public institution that is engaged in electricity, health and petroleum services are “essential to the life of the community and [are] likely to be impeded or interrupted”.
A Similar gazette was issued in April 17, which also included postal services.
According to a gazette notice following services were made essential
2. The supply or distribution of petroleum products and fuel,

3. All service, work or labour, of any description whatsoever, necessary or required to be done in connection with the maintenance, and the reception, care feeding, and treatment, of patients in hospitals, nursing homes, dispensaries, and other similar institutions.
